title: What is the rate of compound interest at which Rs. 1,000 becomes Rs. 5,000 in 4 years? - Quora

response.answer_text: Roughly is 50% CAGR 1000*(1.5^4)=~5062₹ So 1000 is the principal Amount which you want to invest 50% is the rate of interest if you want your investment to be 5x in 4 years and 4 years is the time horizon for what you want your money to park for. This is theoretically, I don't think there is any person or institution which can give you 50% CAGR for years. Still you have any doubt please let me know Thanks, Pujan shah
